newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KNP BT, KPN TO SETTLE NAME CLASH AMICABLY.
newsitem.headline: KNP BT, KPN TO SETTLE NAME CLASH AMICABLY.

text.p: Dutch paper maker and office products group KNP BT and Dutch PTT said on Tuesday they have agreed to reach an amicable settlement over the problem of the similarity of their names.
They said they will still be asking the court in the Hague to pronounce a verdict. It is expected to do so on Wednesday.

KNP BT (Koninklijke Nederlandse Papierfabrieken) launched the action against Dutch PTT, complaining that PTT's use of the abbreviation KPN (for Koninklijke PTT Nederlanden) caused confusion among its clients and the financial world.
